space.arim.api.platform.sponge

Class SpongeRegistrable

  • java.lang.Object
    • space.arim.api.platform.PlatformRegistrable
      • space.arim.api.platform.sponge.SpongeRegistrable
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    space.arim.universal.registry.Registrable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DefaultAsyncExecution, DefaultSyncExecution, DefaultUUIDResolver

    public abstract class SpongeRegistrable
extends PlatformRegistrable
    A helper class for resources registered on Sponge.
    Subclassing SpongeRegistrable provides useful default implementations of Registrable.getName(), Registrable.getAuthor(), and Registrable.getVersion() based on the corresponding PluginContainer. See PlatformRegistrable.getName(), PlatformRegistrable.getAuthor(), and PlatformRegistrable.getVersion() for details.

    Usage:
    1. The service type must be an interface to use SpongeRegistrable.
    2. Let your registered implementation of the service type extend SpongeRegistrable.
    3. Use the Sponge plugin manager (Sponge.getPluginManager()) to retrieve a PluginContainer for your plugin.
    4. Provide super constructor SpongeRegistrable(PluginContainer) with your PluginContainer.

    Example:
    You want your resource called 'SuperChat' to be registered as a ChatProvider (Note that ChatProvider must be an interface which extends Registrable).
    Your SuperChat class should look this: 
    
 public class SuperChat extends SpongeRegistrable implements ChatProvider {
   public SuperChat(PluginContainer plugin) {
     super(plugin);
   }
   public byte getPriority() {
     return RegistryPriority.NORMAL;
   }
 }
    Your main plugin class should look like this: 
    
  @Plugin(id = "yourpluginid", name = "SuperChat")
 public class SuperChatPlugin {
   public SuperChatPlugin() {
     // Getting your plugin
     PluginContainer plugin = Sponge.getPluginManager().getPlugin("yourpluginid").get();
     // Creating your SuperChat chat provider
     SuperChat chat = new SuperChat(plugin);
     // Registering your chat provider
     UniversalRegistry.get().register(ChatProvider.class, chat);
   }
 }
    Good, now you don't have to worry about overriding #getName, #getAuthor, and #getVersion in your SuperChat resource. SpongeRegistrable automatically takes care of all of that.
    Author:
    A248

    • Constructor Detail

      • SpongeRegistrable

        public SpongeRegistrable(org.spongepowered.api.plugin.PluginContainer plugin)
        Initialises the abstract class from a provided PluginContainer. The Sponge plugin which is registering a resource should use its own PluginContainer.

        The PluginContainer will be used for Registrable.getName(), Registrable.getAuthor(), and Registrable.getVersion().
        Parameters:
        plugin - the plugin main

    • Method Detail

      • getPlugin

        protected final org.spongepowered.api.plugin.PluginContainer getPlugin()
        Gets the PluginContainer associated with this SpongeRegistrable for convenient use.
        Returns:
        the plugin
